attributes.action: No more dog breed bans use restrictions instead
attributes.additional_details:
We believe banning one ‘type’ will not stop the people who seek to use dogs as weapons/ to intimidate/ or abuse dogs in such a way they become a danger 
To impose restrictions on  breeds of concern rather than an outright ban
Including a registration scheme and responsible dog ownership course
attributes.background:
For the government to use section 2 subsection 1  to impose some restrictions on breeds that are deemed to pose a greater risk 

We want the government to use this part of the amendment to section 1 rather than outright banning further breeds

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petitions, which call for similar action:

Remove breed specific legislation. Consider alternative methods for dog control: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/638509

Introduce screening process for dog owners: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/643631

Introduce licences, mandatory training and annual vet visits to own a dog: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/643739
